SecurityMeasures: Hashing and authentication for session handling

Steps.Description: Obtain the source code of the index.php file

StepDetails.Hypothesis: By examining the source code, the attacker can gain insights into the functionality and potential vulnerabilities of the web application.
StepDetails.Action: Access the URL http://138.68.228.12/?is_debug=1 to retrieve the source code.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully obtains the source code of the index.php file.

Steps.Description: Bypass countermeasures to gain control of the $whoareyou variable

StepDetails.Hypothesis: By manipulating the HTTP request and exploiting vulnerabilities in the parsing and validation of the request, the attacker can gain control of the $whoareyou variable.
StepDetails.Action: Craft an HTTP request with a specific payload to bypass the countermeasures.
StepDetails.Result: The $whoareyou variable is successfully controlled by the attacker.

Steps.Description: Pass conditional checks to get redirected to another stage

StepDetails.Hypothesis: By passing conditional checks on the $whoareyou variable and the alien parameter, the attacker can get redirected to another stage of the challenge.
StepDetails.Action: Use the provided bash script to send a customized HTTP request and obtain the PHPSESSID with auth set.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully obtains the PHPSESSID with auth set and gets redirected to another stage.

Steps.Description: Abuse the type attribute in the form to execute arbitrary code

StepDetails.Hypothesis: By manipulating the type attribute in the form, the attacker can execute arbitrary code and potentially gain unauthorized access.
StepDetails.Action: Send a request with a non-alphanumeric type attribute to execute the reverse shell script.
StepDetails.Result: The reverse shell script is executed and the attacker gains unauthorized access.

Steps.Description: Retrieve the flag by accessing a specific URL

StepDetails.Hypothesis: By accessing a specific URL, the attacker can retrieve the flag and complete the challenge.
StepDetails.Action: Visit the URL http://138.68.228.12/alien_message/super_secret_shell.php?_=system&__=rgrep MeePwn /var/www/ to retrieve the flag.
